metadata.title: CVE-2019-12269 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: Enigmail before 2.0.11 allows PGP signature spoofing: for an inline PGPmessage, an attacker can cause the product to display a "correctly signed"message indication, but display different unauthenticated text.

criterions.comment: enigmail: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
